medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e), ink and color on paper
portfolio: Eight Views of Underworld Characters (Mitate shiranami hakkei 見立白浪八景)
signed: 国周画 {Kunichika ga} and red toshidama seal
text:
Since the 17th century, The Eight Views–originally referring to scenic spots around the Chinese Xiao and Xiang Rivers–has been a well-established theme in Japanese art. 
Here, the eight locales are taken from famous places in the city of Edo (present-day Tokyo) and are juxtaposed with popular actors in the roles of well-known thieves and robbers. Kabuki plays on the underworld were popular during the mid-19th century, especially during the hot summer months when this series was put on the market, as the storylines were meant to give viewers a chill.
title: Evening Glow at Eitaibashi: Actor Ichikawa Kodanji IV as Oniazami Seishichi
